Summary: Solid amber orb. Rising north with a tight zig-zag flight pattern north. Slowed to a straight flight path and than stopped and faded out.
Object Flight Path: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
divs: sighting detailswalking north on bowles avenue at 11:30pm. was listening to a radio program via a wireless headset through my phone 3g on youtube. my phone went in and out and my headphones lost bluetooth connection. i pulled out my phone at eye level. my phone had froze. i noticed in the corner of my eye an amber light at the treeline. a little smaller than a advil pill. it was ascending north and in a tight zig-zag flight pattern. towards ursa major. immediately i knew it was not a plane or a sattalite. nor was it the space station. this was by definition a unidentified flying object. i tried to get to my camera on my htc evo 4g but it was frozen. the flight pattern continued north but straitened out. and it also slowed to almost a halt. i sensed it would fade out. and thats what the object did. i watched it come from behind the trees to were it disapeared at 60 degrees. when you encounter a sighting of this kind your mind has trouble understanding what it is actually seeing. i did my best to stay calm and observe. the color and size of the object does not fit any description of any known plane\sattalite\ or planet. i was a witness to a fireball\meteor sighting last month here in st.louis and made the report on a meteorlogical website. many other reports were made of that fireball sighting and that is my hope with this sighting. it was not a meteor i saw tonite. the flight pattern was amazing. i have had 3 sightings in the last two years. i made a similar report last year in anahiem california of a similar amber teardropped shaped object that ejected another orb from beneath it. the colors of these two sightings are the same. but my sighting in california was at a lower altitude. this one was very far away. i hope this information is helpful. i will keep my eye on the sky.
